verses.kjv: And they continued three years without war between Syria and Israel.
verses.ct: For 3 years there was no war between Syria and Israel.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the third year, that Jehoshaphat the king of Judah came down to the king of Israel.
verses.ct: In the 3rd year, King Jehoshaphat of Judah went to visit the king of Israel.

verses.kjv: And the king of Israel said unto his servants, Know ye that Ramoth in Gilead is ours, and we be still, and take it not out of the hand of the king of Syria?
verses.ct: The king of Israel said to his officials, "You realize that Ramoth in Gilead belongs to us, right? Yet we've done nothing to take it back from the king of Syria."

verses.kjv: And he said unto Jehoshaphat, Wilt thou go with me to battle to Ramothgilead? And Jehoshaphat said to the king of Israel, I am as thou art, my people as thy people, my horses as thy horses.
verses.ct: Then he asked Jehoshaphat, "Will you join me in attacking Ramoth-gilead?" Jehoshaphat replied to the king of Israel, "I'm with you completely — my troops are your troops, my horses are your horses."

verses.kjv: And Jehoshaphat said unto the king of Israel, Enquire, I pray thee, at the word of the LORD to day.
verses.ct: But Jehoshaphat also said to the king of Israel, "First, please ask for the LORD's guidance on this."

verses.kjv: Then the king of Israel gathered the prophets together, about four hundred men, and said unto them, Shall I go against Ramothgilead to battle, or shall I forbear? And they said, Go up; for the LORD shall deliver it into the hand of the king.
verses.ct: So the king of Israel assembled the prophets — about 400 of them — and asked, "Should I attack Ramoth-gilead, or should I hold back?" They answered, "Go ahead! The Lord will give the king victory over it."

verses.kjv: And Jehoshaphat said, Is there not here a prophet of the LORD besides, that we might enquire of him?
verses.ct: Jehoshaphat asked, "Isn't there another prophet of the LORD we could consult?"

verses.kjv: And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat, There is yet one man, Micaiah the son of Imlah, by whom we may enquire of the LORD: but I hate him; for he doth not prophesy good concerning me, but evil. And Jehoshaphat said, Let not the king say so.
verses.ct: The king of Israel told Jehoshaphat, "There is one more man we could ask — Micaiah son of Imlah. But I can't stand him because he never prophesies anything good about me, only disaster." Jehoshaphat said, "The king shouldn't talk like that."

verses.kjv: Then the king of Israel called an officer, and said, Hasten hither Micaiah the son of Imlah.
verses.ct: So the king of Israel called over an official and said, "Bring Micaiah son of Imlah here right away."

verses.kjv: And the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah sat each on his throne, having put on their robes, in a void place in the entrance of the gate of Samaria; and all the prophets prophesied before them.
verses.ct: The king of Israel and King Jehoshaphat of Judah were each sitting on their thrones, dressed in their royal robes, at an open area near the entrance of the gate of Samaria, while all the prophets were prophesying in front of them.

verses.kjv: And Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah made him horns of iron: and he said, Thus saith the LORD, With these shalt thou push the Syrians, until thou have consumed them.
verses.ct: Zedekiah son of Chenaanah had made iron horns for himself and declared, "This is what the LORD says: With these you will gore the Syrians until they are completely destroyed."

verses.kjv: And all the prophets prophesied so, saying, Go up to Ramothgilead, and prosper: for the LORD shall deliver it into the king’s hand.
verses.ct: All the prophets were saying the same thing: "Attack Ramoth-gilead and succeed! The LORD will give the king victory over it."

verses.kjv: And the messenger that was gone to call Micaiah spake unto him, saying, Behold now, the words of the prophets declare good unto the king with one mouth: let thy word, I pray thee, be like the word of one of them, and speak that which is good.
verses.ct: The messenger who had gone to get Micaiah told him, "Listen, every single prophet has given the king a favorable message. Please agree with them and say something positive."

verses.kjv: And Micaiah said, As the LORD liveth, what the LORD saith unto me, that will I speak.
verses.ct: But Micaiah said, "As surely as the LORD lives, I will only say what the LORD tells me to say."

verses.kjv: So he came to the king. And the king said unto him, Micaiah, shall we go against Ramothgilead to battle, or shall we forbear? And he answered him, Go, and prosper: for the LORD shall deliver it into the hand of the king.
verses.ct: When he arrived before the king, the king asked him, "Micaiah, should we attack Ramoth-gilead, or should we hold back?" He answered, "Go ahead and succeed! The LORD will give the king victory over it."

verses.kjv: And the king said unto him, How many times shall I adjure thee that thou tell me nothing but that which is true in the name of the LORD?
verses.ct: The king said to him, "How many times do I have to make you swear to tell me only the truth in the name of the LORD?"

verses.kjv: And he said, I saw all Israel scattered upon the hills, as sheep that have not a shepherd: and the LORD said, These have no master: let them return every man to his house in peace.
verses.ct: So Micaiah said, "I saw all of Israel scattered across the hills like sheep without a shepherd. And the LORD said, 'These people have no leader. Let each one go home safely.'"

verses.kjv: And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat, Did I not tell thee that he would prophesy no good concerning me, but evil?
verses.ct: The king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, "Didn't I tell you? He never prophesies anything good about me — only disaster."

verses.kjv: And he said, Hear thou therefore the word of the LORD: I saw the LORD sitting on his throne, and all the host of heaven standing by him on his right hand and on his left.
verses.ct: Micaiah continued, "Then listen to the word of the LORD: I saw the LORD seated on his throne, with the entire army of heaven standing around him on his right and his left.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said, Who shall persuade Ahab, that he may go up and fall at Ramothgilead? And one said on this manner, and another said on that manner.
verses.ct: The LORD asked, 'Who will lure Ahab into attacking Ramoth-gilead so that he falls there?' Various suggestions were offered back and forth.

verses.kjv: And there came forth a spirit, and stood before the LORD, and said, I will persuade him.
verses.ct: Then a spirit came forward, stood in the LORD's presence, and said, 'I will lure him.'

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto him, Wherewith? And he said, I will go forth, and I will be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets. And he said, Thou shalt persuade him, and prevail also: go forth, and do so.
verses.ct: The LORD asked, 'How?' The spirit answered, 'I will go out and be a deceptive spirit speaking through all his prophets.' The LORD said, 'You will succeed in luring him. Go and do it.'"

verses.kjv: Now therefore, behold, the LORD hath put a lying spirit in the mouth of all these thy prophets, and the LORD hath spoken evil concerning thee.
verses.ct: "So now, look — the LORD has placed a deceptive spirit in the mouths of all these prophets of yours. The LORD has declared disaster for you."

verses.kjv: But Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah went near, and smote Micaiah on the cheek, and said, Which way went the Spirit of the LORD from me to speak unto thee?
verses.ct: Then Zedekiah son of Chenaanah walked up and struck Micaiah on the face, saying, "Since when did the Spirit of the LORD leave me to speak through you?"

verses.kjv: And Micaiah said, Behold, thou shalt see in that day, when thou shalt go into an inner chamber to hide thyself.
verses.ct: Micaiah replied, "You'll find out on the day you run from room to room trying to hide."

verses.kjv: And the king of Israel said, Take Micaiah, and carry him back unto Amon the governor of the city, and to Joash the king’s son;
verses.ct: The king of Israel ordered, "Seize Micaiah and take him back to Amon the city governor and to Prince Joash.

verses.kjv: And say, Thus saith the king, Put this fellow in the prison, and feed him with bread of affliction and with water of affliction, until I come in peace.
verses.ct: Tell them, 'The king says: Throw this man in prison and give him nothing but bread and water until I return safely.'"

verses.kjv: And Micaiah said, If thou return at all in peace, the LORD hath not spoken by me. And he said, Hearken, O people, every one of you.
verses.ct: Micaiah responded, "If you actually return safely, then the LORD has not spoken through me." Then he added, "Listen to this, all you people!"

verses.kjv: So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah went up to Ramothgilead.
verses.ct: So the king of Israel and King Jehoshaphat of Judah marched to Ramoth-gilead.

verses.kjv: And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat, I will disguise myself, and enter into the battle; but put thou on thy robes. And the king of Israel disguised himself, and went into the battle.
verses.ct: The king of Israel told Jehoshaphat, "I'll go into battle in disguise, but you wear your royal robes." So the king of Israel disguised himself and entered the battle.

verses.kjv: But the king of Syria commanded his thirty and two captains that had rule over his chariots, saying, Fight neither with small nor great, save only with the king of Israel.
verses.ct: Now the king of Syria had given orders to his 32 chariot commanders: "Don't fight anyone else — focus only on the king of Israel."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat, that they said, Surely it is the king of Israel. And they turned aside to fight against him: and Jehoshaphat cried out.
verses.ct: When the chariot commanders spotted Jehoshaphat, they assumed, "That must be the king of Israel!" They turned to attack him, and Jehoshaphat cried out.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots perceived that it was not the king of Israel, that they turned back from pursuing him.
verses.ct: When the chariot commanders realized he was not the king of Israel, they stopped chasing him.

verses.kjv: And a certain man drew a bow at a venture, and smote the king of Israel between the joints of the harness: wherefore he said unto the driver of his chariot, Turn thine hand, and carry me out of the host; for I am wounded.
verses.ct: But someone drew his bow and shot randomly, and the arrow struck the king of Israel in a gap between the sections of his armor. He told his chariot driver, "Turn around and get me out of the fighting — I've been hit."

verses.kjv: And the battle increased that day: and the king was stayed up in his chariot against the Syrians, and died at even: and the blood ran out of the wound into the midst of the chariot.
verses.ct: The battle raged on that day, and the king was propped up in his chariot facing the Syrians. He died that evening, and blood from his wound pooled in the bottom of the chariot.

verses.kjv: And there went a proclamation throughout the host about the going down of the sun, saying, Every man to his city, and every man to his own country.
verses.ct: As the sun was setting, a cry went through the army: "Every man back to his own city! Every man back to his own land!"

verses.kjv: So the king died, and was brought to Samaria; and they buried the king in Samaria.
verses.ct: So the king died and was brought to Samaria, where they buried him.

verses.kjv: And one washed the chariot in the pool of Samaria; and the dogs licked up his blood; and they washed his armour; according unto the word of the LORD which he spake.
verses.ct: When they washed the chariot at the pool of Samaria, dogs licked up his blood, and prostitutes bathed there — exactly as the LORD had declared.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Ahab, and all that he did, and the ivory house which he made, and all the cities that he built, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.ct: Everything else about Ahab's reign — all his accomplishments, the ivory palace he built, and all the cities he constructed — is recorded in the official records of the kings of Israel.

verses.kjv: So Ahab slept with his fathers; and Ahaziah his son reigned in his stead.
verses.ct: Ahab died and joined his ancestors, and his son Ahaziah became king after him.

verses.kjv: And Jehoshaphat the son of Asa began to reign over Judah in the fourth year of Ahab king of Israel.
verses.ct: Jehoshaphat son of Asa became king of Judah in the 4th year of King Ahab of Israel.

verses.kjv: Jehoshaphat was thirty and five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned twenty and five years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Azubah the daughter of Shilhi.
verses.ct: Jehoshaphat was 35 years old when he became king, and he ruled for 25 years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Azubah daughter of Shilhi.

verses.kjv: And he walked in all the ways of Asa his father; he turned not aside from it, doing that which was right in the eyes of the LORD: nevertheless the high places were not taken away; for the people offered and burnt incense yet in the high places.
verses.ct: He followed the example of his father Asa in every way, never straying from it, and did what was right in the LORD's judgment. However, the hilltop shrines were not removed, and the people continued to offer sacrifices and burn incense at those places.

verses.kjv: And Jehoshaphat made peace with the king of Israel.
verses.ct: Jehoshaphat maintained peaceful relations with the king of Israel.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoshaphat, and his might that he shewed, and how he warred, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
verses.ct: Everything else about Jehoshaphat's reign — the strength he demonstrated and the wars he fought — is recorded in the official records of the kings of Judah.

verses.kjv: And the remnant of the sodomites, which remained in the days of his father Asa, he took out of the land.
verses.ct: He also expelled from the land the remaining male shrine prostitutes who had survived from the time of his father Asa.

verses.kjv: There was then no king in Edom: a deputy was king.
verses.ct: At that time there was no king in Edom; a governor ruled as king.

verses.kjv: Jehoshaphat made ships of Tharshish to go to Ophir for gold: but they went not; for the ships were broken at Eziongeber.
verses.ct: Jehoshaphat built trading ships to sail to Ophir for gold, but they never made the voyage because the ships were wrecked at Ezion-geber.

verses.kjv: Then said Ahaziah the son of Ahab unto Jehoshaphat, Let my servants go with thy servants in the ships. But Jehoshaphat would not.
verses.ct: Ahaziah son of Ahab proposed to Jehoshaphat, "Let my men sail with your men on the ships." But Jehoshaphat refused.

verses.kjv: And Jehoshaphat slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David his father: and Jehoram his son reigned in his stead.
verses.ct: Jehoshaphat died and was buried with his ancestors in the city of his ancestor David, and his son Jehoram became king after him.

verses.kjv: Ahaziah the son of Ahab began to reign over Israel in Samaria the seventeenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah, and reigned two years over Israel.
verses.ct: Ahaziah son of Ahab became king over Israel in Samaria during the 17th year of King Jehoshaphat of Judah, and he ruled Israel for 2 years.

verses.kjv: And he did evil in the sight of the LORD, and walked in the way of his father, and in the way of his mother, and in the way of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin:
verses.ct: He did what was evil in the LORD's judgment, following the ways of his father, his mother, and Jeroboam son of Nebat, who had led Israel into sin.

verses.kjv: For he served Baal, and worshipped him, and provoked to anger the LORD God of Israel, according to all that his father had done.
verses.ct: He served and worshiped Baal, provoking the anger of the LORD, the God of Israel, just as his father had done.
